description: Beal's workhorse static rope with Unicore bonding for canyoning, rappelling, and rope access. The 30 kN break strength and Unicore construction give excellent safety margins.
Beal's Antidote 10.2 is a durable single rope designed for demanding trad and sport climbing. Its thicker diameter and robust construction make it ideal for sharp rock and heavy use.
Beal's Apollo II 11.0 is a heavy-duty single rope for big wall and traditional climbing. The thick 11mm diameter provides maximum durability and reliability on extended routes.
Beal's Berlin 9.8 Unicore is a premium all-purpose rope combining the durability of Unicore construction with exceptional handling. Golden Dry treatment ensures reliability in all conditions.

Beal's workhorse all-round rope with 8 UIAA falls and one of the lowest impact forces in its class at 7.3 kN. Unicore construction bonds the sheath to the core for safety. The Booster III is a proven favorite for sport and trad climbing.
Beal's Cobra II 8.6 Unicore is a half rope designed for multipitch sport and alpine climbing. Unicore construction combined with Dry Cover treatment ensures maximum durability and reliability.
cons: Must be used as half rope

description: The ultralight twin rope for committed alpine objectives. Both strands clip into the same gear, providing the lightest system weight possible. Unicore bonding ensures safety if the sheath is damaged. Golden Dry offers maximum water protection for ice and mixed routes. Expert-only.
pros: Lightest twin system at 36g/m per strand

description: Beal's workhorse half rope for ice and alpine climbing. With an incredible 12 UIAA falls and Unicore bonding, it's one of the most durable half ropes you can buy. Golden Dry for wet conditions.
Heavy-duty static rope for professional and industrial use.
Ultra-low-stretch static rope for rescue and intervention work.
Beal's lightweight performance rope with Unicore bonding and Golden Dry treatment. At 9.1mm and 53 g/m it's one of the lightest single ropes you can buy, ideal for long routes and redpoint attempts.
cons: Thin diameter needs careful device selection

description: Beal's intermediate cragging rope offering the perfect compromise between handling and durability. With 7 UIAA falls and a low 7.5 kN impact force, the Karma suits progressive climbers stepping up from beginner ropes. Made with Bluesign-certified nylon.
pros: Good balance of weight and durability

description: The ultralight Opera is Beal's thinnest single rope, triple-rated for maximum versatility in alpine terrain. Unicore technology bonds the sheath to the core — if the sheath is cut, the rope remains functional. Golden Dry provides the highest level of water protection. Expert-only due to thin diameter.
cons: Not compatible with most assisted braking devices

description: Beal's Rando 8.0 is a ultralight half rope designed for alpine hiking and mountaineering expeditions. Limited to 20-30m lengths, it provides critical redundancy for technical alpine terrain.
Beal's balanced sport rope with Unicore bonding and low impact force (7.8 kN). The 9.4mm diameter handles beautifully in any device while offering better durability than skinnier options.
pros: Low impact force (7.8 kN) — soft catches
Good balance of weight and durability

description: Beal's SunRise 9.2 is a lightweight single rope designed for sport climbing and multipitch routes. With dry treatment and excellent handling, it offers a perfect balance between durability and weight savings.
Beal's The One 9.6 is a versatile all-purpose single rope designed for gym and sport climbing. Oeko-Tex certified for environmental responsibility without sacrificing performance.
Beal's durable everyday rope with Unicore bonding. At 10mm it's tough enough for gym and top-rope abuse, with an impressively low impact force of 7.6 kN for soft catches.
pros: Lowest impact force in class (7.6 kN)

description: Beal's workhorse gym and beginner rope with 48-bobbin construction for a smooth, durable sheath. The Virus 10.0 is ideal for indoor climbing, top-roping, and learning to lead. At 8 UIAA falls and 42% sheath proportion, it's built to last through heavy use.
cons: Too thick for advanced outdoor climbing

description: Beal's Wall Cruiser 9.6 Unicore bridges gym and crag climbing. The Unicore construction provides enhanced durability and handling, with Golden Dry treatment for all-weather performance.

Purpose-built for climbing walls and gyms. The thick 10.5mm diameter with 47% sheath and Unicore bonding provides maximum abrasion resistance for top-roping, auto-belays, and heavy daily gym use. Available in shorter lengths optimized for indoor walls.

Beal's lightweight performance single rope for cragging. With a low 7.5 kN impact force guaranteed, the Zenith delivers soft catches that are easy on gear and bolts. Bluesign-certified nylon sourcing. A great lighter-weight option for experienced sport climbers.

One of the thinnest twin ropes available at just 7.0mm and 36 g/m. The BD 7.0 Dry is designed for technical alpine climbing where two-rope redundancy is essential and every gram counts. Dry Performance treatment for wet and icy conditions.
cons: Twin only — must clip both ropes
Very thin — wears fast on sharp rock

description: A versatile half/twin rope for alpine and ice climbing. At just 48 g/m, the 8.5 Dry is built for demanding alpine routes where weight is critical. Dry Performance treatment keeps it performing in wet and icy conditions. Use as half ropes on wandering routes or twin for straightforward lines.

Black Diamond's skinniest single rope, designed for demanding sport and trad rock climbs. The 9.4mm diameter delivers a supple feel ideal for long multi-pitches and wandering routes. Dry Performance treatment on core and sheath repels moisture effectively.
cons: Thinner ropes wear faster on sharp rock

description: A thick, durable workhorse rope built for top roping, group cragging, and heavy daily use. The 9.9mm diameter provides excellent durability and longevity, making it a great pick for climbers who prioritize rope life over weight savings.
cons: Too thick for demanding alpine routes

description: Black Diamond's 9.2 Dry is a lighter, more nimble dry rope for climbers seeking weight savings without sacrificing durability. Perfect for sport climbing and multipitch routes.
Black Diamond's 9.9 Dry offers dry treatment for all-weather climbing in a versatile diameter. Excellent durability and handling for sport and trad routes.
BlueWater's perfect all-arounder combining performance with exceptional longevity. The 10.5mm Accelerator delivers high UIAA fall rating and very high durability for long-term use on varied climbing.

BlueWater's workhorse all-round rope offering low impact force for a larger diameter. The 10.2mm Eliminator provides excellent durability and handling for sport and trad climbing with balanced performance.
BlueWater's heavy-duty 11mm rope for big wall and guiding applications. Exceptional 15 UIAA fall rating and heavy 77g/m weight provide maximum durability and rope longevity for demanding climbing.

BlueWater's lightweight performance single rope with a unique 40-carrier sheath for a tighter weave despite the thin diameter. The Icon 9.1 is the go-to rope for Tommy Caldwell and Cedar Wright. Light enough for long approaches while still offering 35% sheath mass for durability.
pros: Good value for a skinny rope
cons: Can be stiff and prone to kinking

description: A versatile American-made 9.7mm single rope excelling in sport, trad, and ice climbing. The Lightning Pro boasts 8 UIAA falls with a remarkably low 7.8 kN impact force — among the softest catches in its class. Double Dry treatment keeps it performing in wet conditions.
BlueWater's mid-range single 10mm rope in eye-catching neon colors for excellent visibility. Offers balanced performance for sport and trad climbing with reliable dry treatment.
cons: Neon colors may not appeal to all

description: BlueWater's lightweight advanced rope for sport climbers seeking a thin, responsive feel. The 9.2mm Xenon combines low weight (55g/m) with reliable handling and dry treatment for wet conditions.
Edelrid's ultralight half rope for serious alpine objectives. Triple-rated with 9 UIAA falls (as half), it's one of the most capable thin ropes on the market. Pro Dry and partially recycled.

The world's first climbing rope made from renewable bio-based materials. Over 40% of the Birdlime is made from castor-oil-based material, reducing fossil fuel dependency. Thermo Shield treatment ensures excellent handling. The '1R' designation means 'Reduce' in Edelrid's sustainability system.

The thinner sibling of the Boa Eco 9.8, now at 9.6mm for improved handling. Made from high-quality leftover yarns from Edelrid's own production — each rope looks unique. The '2R' designation means 'Reuse' in Edelrid's sustainability naming. Excellent all-rounder at a budget price.
cons: Each rope looks different — no color consistency

description: The greenest rope in the lineup — made entirely from recycled materials with Bluesign certification and no PFC treatment. The 9.8mm diameter and 9 UIAA falls make it a bombproof gym and single-pitch workhorse. Available in a short 40m gym length. The perfect first rope.

One of the thinnest and lightest single ropes available, also triple-rated for use as a half or twin rope. At 51 g/m the Canary Pro Dry is a specialist tool for alpine climbing and ice routes where every gram matters. Pro Dry treatment meets UIAA water repellent standard.
pros: Pro Dry meets UIAA water standard
47% sheath for durability despite thin diameter
cons: Only 5 UIAA falls as single rope

description: Edelrid's high-fall-count sport rope. With 9 UIAA falls it's one of the most durable 9.5mm ropes on the market. Pro Dry treatment, Bluesign certified, and partially made from recycled materials.

The most robust single rope in Edelrid's lineup. Aramid fibers woven into the sheath provide outstanding cut resistance for sharp rock and big wall climbing. 48-bobbin construction creates a compact, fine sheath. Pro Dry treatment meets UIAA water repellent standard.
pros: Ideal for big wall and demanding multi-pitch
cons: Heavier at 63 g/m due to aramid

description: The world's first rope made from 100% recycled materials — both core and sheath. The NEO 100 3R closes the materials cycle using Edelrid's in-house factory waste from Isny, Germany. Combines mechanically and chemically recycled nylon for zero-compromise performance. Lowest carbon footprint of any Edelrid single rope.
Edelrid's Neo 3R 9.8 is made with recycled materials for environmentally conscious climbers. Maintains excellent performance while reducing environmental impact.

Edelrid's EN 1891 Type A static rope for rappelling, hauling, and rope access. The 10.5mm diameter provides excellent abrasion resistance with 45% sheath and 31kN breaking strength. Available in long cuts up to 200m for fixed line setups. NOT for lead climbing — no dynamic fall absorption.
Edelrid's 11mm workhorse static rope.
Versatile 10mm static rope for canyoning and rescue.

The lightest single rope in the world. At just 48 g/m the Siskin breaks new ground thanks to revolutionary new yarn technology and innovative construction. Triple-rated for single, half, and twin use. PFC-free Eco Dry treatment meets UIAA water repellent standard.
pros: Lightest single rope in the world at 48 g/m
cons: Not suitable for beginners or GriGri

description: Edelrid's Skimmer Eco Dry 7.1 is the lightest half rope available at just 36g/m. Designed for ultralight alpine expeditions with eco-friendly Eco Dry treatment.
Edelrid's Starling Protect Pro Dry 8.2 is a half rope with aramid protection for alpine climbing. The combination of aramid and Dry treatment provides superior protection on sharp terrain.
Lightweight static rope with innovative Link Tec construction.
Edelrid's Swift 48 8.9 is their newest triple-rated rope for 2025, combining sport climbing, rappelling, and top-rope capabilities. Lightweight at 53g/m with excellent handling.

The world's first PFC-free rope to meet the UIAA water repellent standard. Triple-rated for use as a single, half, or twin rope. Lightweight yet durable, the Swift Eco Dry is Edelrid's top pick for redpointing and alpine climbing with uncompromised eco credentials.
pros: World's first PFC-free UIAA dry rope
Light at 52 g/m with 7 UIAA falls
cons: Higher impact force than heavier ropes

description: The ultimate alpine half rope — triple-rated with a record 20 UIAA falls and aramid sheath protection. DuoTec bi-pattern for permanent middle marking. At 42% sheath, it's the most durable half rope on the market. Partially recycled with Bluesign certification.
cons: Heavier for a half rope at 52g/m

description: Tommy Caldwell's signature rope built for multi-pitch mastery. DuoTec bi-pattern marking eliminates middle-mark fade, while Eco Dry treatment is PFC-free. Partially recycled materials and Bluesign certification make it one of the most sustainable performance ropes available.

The ColorTec version of Edelrid's signature Tommy Caldwell rope features a color-change pattern at the middle mark that can never wear off. Smooth sheath feel that's nice on the hands. Eco Dry treatment is PFC-free and meets UIAA water repellent standard.
Edelrid's Tower Lite SyncTec 10.0 is a gym-focused rope with SyncTec core bonding for exceptional handling and durability. Perfect for climbers starting their sport climbing journey.
Edelweiss Perform 3 range rope with advanced HD Cover technology. The 9.8mm Curve combines high durability with balanced handling for sport and trad climbing.
Edelweiss Discover 8 twin rope for backcountry and glacier climbing. SuperEverdry treatment and lightweight 47g/m make it ideal for high alpine expeditions.
Edelweiss Element II 10.2 sets the new standard for all-round single rope performance. Versatile diameter and high UIAA rating make it suitable for all climbing disciplines.
Edelweiss Elite 7.8 ultralight half/twin rope with Unicore and SuperEverdry treatment. Extreme alpine conditions demand extreme lightweight rope — this is it.
Edelweiss Perform 3 range with bi-pattern ARC marking. The 9.5mm Energy ARC delivers super soft catch and very supple feel, ideal for long hard routes.
Edelweiss Geos 10.5 reliable single rope for beginners to advanced climbers. Perfect for gyms and outdoor top rope, with very high durability for training programs and daily use.

An outstanding half/twin rope that shines on ice and alpine climbs. SuperEverDry treatment on both sheath and core keeps it performing in the wettest and coldest conditions. At 46 g/m, it's one of the lightest half ropes available with an impressive 20 UIAA falls rating.
cons: Not suitable as a single rope
Premium price for a half rope

description: Edelweiss Performance 9.2 triple-rated with Unicore bonding. Lightweight at 52g/m with Everdry treatment and very supple handling for versatile single/half/twin use.
Edelweiss Spirit ARC half rope with Unicore bonding and ARC bi-pattern. Triple-rated (single/half/twin) for maximum alpine versatility. Ultra-lightweight at 45g/m with Everdry treatment.
Fixe Foixarda 9.8 beginner-friendly, safe sport climbing rope. PFC-free and reliable for climbers starting their sport climbing journey.
Fixe Montserrat 9.4 lightweight sport rope for rock routes. Available in 80m length option, with PFC-free treatment and very supple feel.

Named after the legendary sport climbing crag in Catalonia, the Fixe Oliana is a triple-certified lightweight all-rounder. At 58 g/m with a remarkably low 7.1 kN impact force, it delivers one of the softest catches of any single rope. Fusion technology bonds core to sheath for zero slippage.
Fixe Pedraforca 8.8 alpine half rope with Full Dry Fusion treatment available. Very supple and lightweight for mountain climbing.
Fixe Rocco 10 thick, durable gym and top-rope rope available in long lengths up to 100m. High UIAA rating and very durable for heavy training use.
Fixe Rodellar 9.4 Dry Fusion with innovative sheath-lock system preventing sheath slippage. PFC-free dry treatment and high durability for sport and trad climbing.
Fixe Siurana 9.6 workhorse rope with Endurance braid technology for abrasion resistance. PFC-free and dry-treated, a limestone specialist from Catalonia.
Fixe Zen 8.1 ultralight alpine half rope in neon orange for visibility. Full Dry treatment with minimal weight for high altitude expeditions.
Mammut's burliest single rope. At 10.2mm it's thick, forgiving, and practically indestructible — perfect for gym rats, top-rope warriors, and anyone who values longevity over weight savings.
cons: Bulky to carry on long routes

description: An extremely lightweight half rope for ice climbing, mixed climbing, and mountaineering. At just 37 g/m, the 7.5 Alpine Sender Dry is one of the lightest half ropes in existence. The smooth sheath from high-quality yarns ensures easy handling despite the thin diameter.
The ultralight single rope for alpinists. At just 48 g/m it shaves weight where it counts, while triple-rated certification gives you flexibility on routes where you need it.
Mammut's 8.0 Alpine Classic is a lightweight half rope for alpine climbing. Without dry treatment, it offers maximum affordability for experienced alpine climbers.
Mammut's 8.0 Alpine Core Protect Dry features aramid protection for cut resistance on sharp alpine terrain. Dry treatment provides all-weather reliability.

Mammut's flagship half rope with aramid core protection for sharp-edge alpine terrain. At 8.0mm and 41g/m, it's remarkably light for a half rope with 12 UIAA falls. Dry treated and PFC-free. Used in pairs, clipped alternately for wandering trad and alpine routes.
pros: 12 UIAA falls — excellent for half rope
cons: Must be used in pairs (double the cost)

description: Mammut's 8.0 Alpine Eco Dry combines environmental responsibility with alpine performance. PFC-free and Bluesign certified for eco-conscious climbers.

Mammut's ultralight performance rope for sending hard routes. At 52 g/m, the Crag Sender Dry is among the lightest 9mm single ropes on the market. A quiver-of-one rope that works from cragging to alpine climbing with UIAA Dry treatment.

Based on the tried-and-tested Infinity construction, the Gym Classic is optimized for indoor climbing. The 42% sheath proportion ensures durability on gym walls while the 9.5mm diameter keeps it light. Available in short gym-friendly lengths at an affordable price.
pros: Light at 58 g/m for a gym rope

description: Mammut's all-around performer with Dry treatment. The Infinity splits the difference between weight and durability at 9.5mm, with 8 UIAA falls and buttery handling. A crag workhorse.

Mammut's best-selling all-round rope for sport and trad climbing. The 9.8mm diameter offers an excellent balance of handling and durability at a very attractive price. With 8 UIAA falls and a low 7.8 kN impact force, it provides a soft catch while being robust enough for regular use.
cons: No dry treatment in Classic version

description: Mammut's workhorse single rope with Dry treatment for all-round sport and trad climbing. The 9.5mm diameter hits the sweet spot between handling and durability, with a supple feel that feeds smoothly through any belay device. Bluesign certified and PFC-free.
Mammut's 9.5 Crag Dry Duodess features a unique bi-pattern design appealing to women climbers. Same reliable performance as the standard Crag with distinctive visual styling.
Mammut's 9.8 Crag Dry offers a slightly thicker diameter with excellent durability for sport and trad climbing. Dry treatment ensures all-weather reliability.

The most cut-resistant climbing rope on the market. Mammut weaves aramid fibers into the sheath for unmatched protection against sharp rock edges. Ideal for alpine and trad climbing on rough terrain where rope durability is paramount.
pros: Perfect for alpine and ice climbing
cons: Higher impact force than non-aramid ropes

description: Mammut's triple-rated quiver-of-one rope. The 48-bobbin sheath creates a smooth, abrasion-resistant surface. UIAA Dry treatment keeps water absorption under 1.5%. Use as a single for sport, half for wandering trad, or twin for alpine — one rope does it all.

Mammut's best budget rope that hits the sweet spot in diameter and weight. Made with sustainability in mind as part of the We Care line, using Bluesign-certified and PFC-free materials. Same excellent handling as the premium Crag Dry at a significantly lower price.
cons: Fewer UIAA falls than heavier ropes

description: Mammut's all-round rope with Protect sheath treatment for enhanced abrasion resistance. With 9 UIAA falls and BiCo Sense technology for instant middle mark detection, the Eternity Protect excels at versatile sport and trad climbing. Low 30% dynamic elongation.

Mammut's best value rope for gym, top-roping, and beginner outdoor climbing. With 9 UIAA falls and a 10mm diameter, the Galaxy Classic delivers outstanding durability at an incredibly low price. Available in lengths from 40m to 80m. Bluesign certified.

Mammut's most abrasion-resistant rope ever, purpose-built for gym climbing. The Workhorse construction creates a fine, smooth surface for maximum sheath durability on rough gym walls. With 42% sheath proportion and 8 UIAA falls, it's built to handle thousands of gym laps.
Lightweight static rope for caving and top-rope setups.
Mid-diameter static rope for versatile low-stretch applications.

Maxim's ultralight triple-rated workhorse combining single, half, and twin capability. Super thin 7.7mm diameter at just 46g/m, perfect for alpine climbing and rapid ascents. Endura Dry treatment keeps weight minimal while providing water protection.
pros: Super thin for minimal pack weight

description: Maxim's versatile workhorse 10.5mm rope for top rope, trad, and big wall climbing. Endura Dry core treatment provides excellent wet weather protection while maintaining great handling characteristics. Ideal for demanding multi-pitch expeditions.

Maxim's all-round 9.9mm rope designed for sport and trad climbing. The Equinox Elite balances handling, durability, and versatility for climbers who want one rope that does it all. Endura Dry treatment and excellent UIAA fall rating make it reliable in varied conditions.
Maxim's popular all-around rope. The Glider 9.9 is a reliable workhorse that handles well, lasts long, and won't break the bank. A solid choice for gym and cragging.

Maxim's all-round performance rope with a new 9.4mm construction that delivers slick handling and excellent durability. Made in the USA and EU with PFC/PFAS-free sheath. Endura Dry core treatment protects against moisture. Average 9 UIAA falls in testing despite 5 minimum rating.

One of the lightest half/twin ropes on the market at just 39 g/m. The Unity is built for weight-conscious alpinists tackling demanding mountain routes and glacier travel. Reduced drag construction and edge protection make it tough despite the thin diameter.
Ocun's Crest 8.1 is a lightweight half rope designed for alpine climbing. Dry treatment and Bluesign certification make it an environmentally conscious choice.

A durable and comfortable all-round rope from Ocun, perfect for beginners and advancing climbers. The 9.8mm diameter provides excellent handling and 8 UIAA falls at a budget-friendly price. Heat Sheath Treatment ensures pleasant handling from day one.

Ocun's gym and beginner rope, built for thousands of meters of climbing. The 10.0mm diameter provides maximum durability and a comfortable grip for top-roping and learning to lead. With 10 UIAA falls, it's one of the most durable ropes in its class.
Ocun's Peak 8.5 is a versatile half rope for multipitch sport and alpine climbing. The balanced diameter provides good handling and weight savings.

Ocun's all-round single rope for experienced climbers. With 9 UIAA falls and a remarkably low 7.4 kN impact force, the Spirit delivers outstanding durability with soft catches. PFC-free water-repellent treatment keeps it performing in any conditions.

Ocun's flagship performance rope for redpoint and onsight climbing. The 9.1mm diameter keeps weight down at 55 g/m while Core Thermal Treatment and Heat Sheath Treatment provide improved handling and mechanical properties. PFC-free water-repellent treatment.
cons: Not widely available in all markets

description: Petzl's flagship sport rope with Duratec Dry treatment for all-weather performance. The tight weave and smooth handling make it a favourite for long days at the crag.
pros: Duratec Dry treatment — excellent water resistance
cons: Fewer UIAA falls than some competitors

description: Petzl's workhorse static rope for professional use, caving, and fixed-line work.
Petzl's versatile all-rounder. The thick sheath (41%) and 9.8mm diameter make it durable and forgiving, ideal for cragging and indoor use without the premium of dry treatment.

Petzl's gym-specific version of the Contact rope. Available in shorter lengths (30–50m) optimized for indoor walls. The Contact Wall has the same lightweight construction as the outdoor Contact but at a lower price point without dry treatment.
Petzl's gym workhorse. Thick and tough at 10.1mm, the Mambo takes abuse session after session. The ideal first rope or dedicated gym/top-rope line.
pros: 8 UIAA falls — impressive for its diameter

description: Versatile 10.5mm static rope for access work and rescue.
Petzl's ultralight half/twin rope for weight-conscious alpinists. At just 40 g/m, it pairs beautifully with the Reverso for efficient multi-pitch and alpine climbing.
Lightweight semi-static rope for canyoning and caving.

Petzl's lightest half rope for demanding alpine, ice, and mountaineering routes. At 44 g/m with Duratec Dry treatment, the Rumba 8.0 is built for all-season use. The reinforced sheath provides durability despite the thin 8mm diameter.
cons: Only 7 UIAA falls as half rope

description: Petzl's versatile half rope for multi-pitch climbing and mountaineering. With 9 UIAA falls and 48-carrier construction, the Salsa 8.2 is one of the most durable half ropes available. Duratec Dry treatment ensures performance in all weather conditions.
pros: 9 UIAA falls — excellent half rope durability

description: Petzl's durable half rope for multi-pitch rock climbing. With 10 UIAA falls and a 48-carrier construction, the Tango 8.5 is one of the most durable half ropes available. The thick sheath provides excellent grip and great handling for belay devices.
cons: Not ideal for ice/alpine without dry treatment

description: Petzl's flagship triple-rated rope combines EverFlex thermal treatment for consistent handling with Duratec Dry water protection. At 9.2mm and 52g/m, it's light enough for alpine objectives while remaining compatible with assisted-braking devices. A do-everything rope for experienced climbers.

Petzl's ultra-lightweight triple-rated rope for elite mountaineering. The Guide Dry treatment is Petzl's most advanced water repellent, ensuring performance in the harshest alpine conditions. At 52 g/m with 9.0mm diameter, it's the quiver-of-one rope for mountain professionals.
pros: Guide Dry — Petzl's best dry treatment

description: Singing Rock Accord 8.3 half+twin rope with compact design and minimal interfiber friction. Dry-treated with 13 EN 1891 falls.
Singing Rock Duran 10.4 with perfect abrasion resistance via Route 44 technology. 8 UIAA falls and 68g/m for durable multi-pitch and big wall climbing.
Singing Rock Gemini 7.9 ultralight half+twin rope. 39-43g/m range with high 16 twin falls and 5 half falls for alpine and ice climbing.

A solid, affordable workhorse from Czech brand Singing Rock. The Hero 9.6 is a throwback to sturdy, high-endurance ropes at a budget price. Ultrasonic cut rope ends and middle mark included. Great for single-pitch sport climbing and general use.
Singing Rock Icon 9.3 sport climbing rope with SingleTech technology. Dry treated and 59g/m weight with 7 UIAA falls.
Singing Rock Kata 9.7 high-end rope with InterCore technology. 61g/m with high safety factor and very supple feel for demanding sport climbing.
Singing Rock's Mystic 10.1 is an affordable all-purpose rope for gym and sport climbing. Thicker diameter provides excellent durability and handling for beginners.
Singing Rock Patron 11 high safety factor durable workhorse. Exceptional 16 UIAA falls at 79g/m for big wall and guiding applications.
Singing Rock's Score 9.6 is a balanced single rope with dry treatment for sport climbing. Excellent value for intermediate and advanced climbers.
Workhorse static rope for professional and recreational use.
Heavy-duty 11mm static rope for demanding applications.
Singing Rock Storm 9.8 all-round rope with great balance. 9 UIAA falls, 65g/m, and dry treatment for versatile sport, trad, and multi-pitch use.

Sterling's top pick for single-pitch sport routes. The Aero 9.2 delivers a lightweight and supple feel with XEROS dry treatment for all-weather performance. An excellent choice for climbers pushing their limits on sport routes.
cons: Not ideal for trad on sharp rock

description: Sterling's CanyonPrime 9.2 is a specialized semi-static rope for canyon rappelling. Its low elongation and high fall rating make it ideal for vertical environment climbing.
Sterling's flagship sport rope, made in the USA. The 40% sheath gives exceptional durability for cragging, while DryXP sheath treatment adds water resistance. A favourite at American crags.
Sterling's Fusion Nano IX 9.0 DryXP features enhanced DryXP treatment for superior water resistance. Lightweight and durable for sport climbing.
High-tenacity polyester static rope with very low elongation.

Sterling's premium lightweight single rope with XEROS dry treatment that meets UIAA water repellent standard. The bi-pattern design makes middle identification instant — no fading marks. Excellent for multi-pitch climbing where you need reliable middle detection.
pros: BiColor pattern for instant middle ID

description: Sterling's professional static rope for guiding, rescue, and big wall operations. The 40% sheath and 28 kN break strength make it one of the toughest static lines available.

Sterling's beefy workhorse rope inspired by big wall climbers, designed to survive multiple gnarly expeditions. The T-10 combines 10mm durability with XEROS dry treatment for unmatched all-weather resilience. 8 UIAA falls with Bluesign-certified materials.

Sterling's flagship cragging workhorse with XEROS dry treatment meeting the UIAA water repellent standard. Among the most durable ropes tested, the Velocity XEROS excels at heavy-use cragging and trad climbing. Excellent moisture resistance for all-weather performance.
Sterling's VR10 10.1 is a gym-focused rope with a thicker diameter for optimal handling in indoor climbing environments. Durable and affordable for regular gym use.

The ideal rope for glaciers, alpine climbing, and ski mountaineering. Triple-rated and ultra-light at 42 g/m, the Alpine 7.9 provides maximum versatility for mountain use. TeFix Complete Shield dry treatment for all-weather performance.
cons: Very thin for single rope use

description: Tendon's trad and winter climbing specialist. 9 UIAA falls and 7.4 kN impact force give you the safety margin you want on runout routes. Complete Shield treatment handles wet and icy conditions.
Tendon's Hattrick 9.7 is a triple-rated rope combining sport climbing, rappelling, and top-rope capabilities. TeFix treatment ensures excellent durability and all-weather performance.

Tendon's ultra-light triple-rated rope for sending hard projects. At just 50 g/m, the Master 8.6 is one of the lightest ropes with triple certification. TeFix Complete Shield dry treatment ensures performance in wet conditions. UIAA certified.

Czech-made all-rounder with TeFix sheath technology for consistent handling over the rope's lifetime. Complete Shield dry treatment covers core and sheath. Excellent value for a fully treated 9.4mm single rope. A strong alternative to the big Western European brands.
Tendon's Master Pro 9.2 Complete Shield combines aramid protection with Complete Shield technology for maximum durability. Ideal for sharp rock and demanding trad climbing.

Tendon's budget workhorse rope — durable, reliable, and incredibly affordable. The Smart 10.0 offers 8 UIAA falls and low 5.7% static elongation at the lowest price point in its class. Perfect as a first rope or dedicated gym/top-rope cord.

Tendon's budget-friendly all-rounder. The Smart Lite 9.8 is just as durable as any Tendon rope but at a fantastically low price — making it a great first rope for new outdoor climbers. Czech-made quality at an entry-level price.
pros: Light for its class at 62 g/m

description: Budget-friendly 10mm static rope for caving and fixed-line.
Durable 11mm static rope for demanding applications.
Tendon's Trust 11.0 is a gym-focused thick rope with exceptional durability. The 11mm diameter provides optimal handling for indoor climbing and high-volume gym use.

Triple-rated for single, double, or twin use with an impressive 9 UIAA fall count. The Red Flag treatment marks the final five meters at each end with bright red dye for end-of-rope awareness. One of the most versatile ropes on the market at just 56 g/m.
pros: 9 UIAA falls — excellent durability for diameter
cons: Higher impact force than some competitors

description: Trango's versatile 9.8mm workhorse with excellent dry treatment and great value. High 13 UIAA fall rating combined with supple handling makes it an outstanding all-rounder for climbers seeking reliable performance without premium pricing.
